de.hotware.hotsound.audio.data

Interface IAudioDevice

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.lang.AutoCloseable
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    IJavaSoundPlaybackAudioDevice
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    BaseAudioDevice, BasicPlaybackAudioDevice, MultiAudioDevice, RecordingAudioDevice

    public interface IAudioDevice
extends java.lang.AutoCloseable
    Base interface for all classes that receive all the Sound input and plays it back or whatever it should do with it. Has to be reopenable.
    Author:
    Martin Braun

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static class  IAudioDevice.AudioDeviceException 

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void close()
      stops the IAudioDevice and closes all the opened resources may be reused afterwards!
      void flush()
      blocks until all current audio has been played
      boolean isClosed() 
      boolean isPaused() 
      void open(javax.sound.sampled.AudioFormat pAudioFormat)
      opens and initializes the IAudioDevice for playback
      void pause(boolean pPause)
      pauses/unpauses the IAudioDevice and the playback
      int write(byte[] pData, int pStart, int pLength)
      writes to the IAudioDevice's output.

    • Method Detail

      • write

        int write(byte[] pData,
        int pStart,
        int pLength)
          throws IAudioDevice.AudioDeviceException
        writes to the IAudioDevice's output. Normally the way to write to its DataLine
        Returns:
        number of bytes written
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if not opened yet
        IAudioDevice.AudioDeviceException - if writing fails

      • open

        void open(javax.sound.sampled.AudioFormat pAudioFormat)
          throws IAudioDevice.AudioDeviceException
        opens and initializes the IAudioDevice for playback
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if opened while not being closed
        IAudioDevice.AudioDeviceException - if opening fails

      • isPaused

        boolean isPaused()

      • pause

        void pause(boolean pPause)
        pauses/unpauses the IAudioDevice and the playback
